intro: Cleistanthus praetermissus, commonly known as the Malayan cleistanthus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, and it is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
